update.description:
I made a tricycle model with spherical wheels and front steering. It will be used in a test for the gazebo WheelSlipPlugin (added in [gazebo PR 2950](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2950/adding-wheelslipplugin-for-adding-wheel/diff)).

![trike.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3164252219-trike.png)

The model has an embedded-ruby template, and I've tinkered with a "chopper" model using the following patch:

~~~
diff -r 97a7daf87cb5 trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb
--- a/trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb    Thu May 31 13:29:34 2018 -0700
+++ b/trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb    Thu May 31 16:30:41 2018 -0700
@@ -7,11 +7,11 @@
 
   # Geometry
   wheel_radius    = 0.15
-  wheelbase       = 6 * wheel_radius
-  half_track      = wheelbase * Math.tan(30 * Math::PI/180)
-  caster_angle    = 10 * Math::PI / 180.0
+  wheelbase       = 10 * wheel_radius
+  half_track      = 0.8*wheelbase * Math.tan(30 * Math::PI/180)
+  caster_angle    = 50 * Math::PI / 180.0
   fork_length     = 1.5 * wheel_radius * Math.sqrt(2)
-  headtube_length = 0.5 * fork_length
+  headtube_length = 1.0 * fork_length
   front_steer_L   = headtube_length + fork_length
   front_steer_dx  = front_steer_L * Math.sin(caster_angle)
   front_steer_dz  = front_steer_L * Math.cos(caster_angle)
@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@
   fork_offset = fork_length - 0.5*front_steer_L
   wheel_x0     = rear_steer_dx
   wheel_y0     = half_track
-  steer_limit  = 55 * Math::PI / 180.0
+  steer_limit  = 30 * Math::PI / 180.0
 
   rear_wheel_locations = {
     "rear_left"   => {:x0 => -wheel_x0, :y0 => wheel_y0 },
~~~

The chopper is not committed in this branch; it's just an example of how the parameterized template can be used.

![chopper.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1384378253-chopper.png)
update.title: Tricycle with spherical wheels: trisphere_cycle

content.raw: thanks for the review and the example world! I'll use it in a tutorial
content.html: thanks for the review and the example world! I'll use it in a tutorial

content.raw:
Nice! All the params are spot-on:

![tricyclevisuals.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/90462838-tricyclevisuals.png)

And it's fun to drive too :smile: 

![tricycle2.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3203804191-tricycle2.gif)


~~~
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
  <world name="default">

    <gui fullscreen='0'>
      <plugin name='keyboard' filename='libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so'/>
    </gui>

    <!-- A global light source -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>
    <!-- A ground plane -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://ground_plane</uri>
    </include>

    <model name="cycle">
      <include>
        <uri>model://trisphere_cycle</uri>
      </include>

      <plugin name='keystojoints' filename='libKeysToJointsPlugin.so'>

        <!-- up-arrow -->
        <map key='16777235' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_left_spin' scale='500' type='force'/>
        <map key='16777235' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_right_spin' scale='500' type='force'/>
        <!-- down-arrow -->
        <map key='16777237' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_left_spin' scale='-500' type='force'/>
        <map key='16777237' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_right_spin' scale='-500' type='force'/>

        <!-- left-arrow -->
        <map key='16777234' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_front_steer' scale='0.1' type='position' kp='1000' ki='0' kd='10'/>
        <!-- right-arrow -->
        <map key='16777236' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_front_steer' scale='-0.1' type='position' kp='1000' ki='0' kd='10'/>

      </plugin>
    </model>
  </world>
</sdf>

~~~
content.html:
Nice! All the params are spot-on:

And it's fun to drive too 

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
  <world name="default">

    <gui fullscreen='0'>
      <plugin name='keyboard' filename='libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so'/>
    </gui>

    <!-- A global light source -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>
    <!-- A ground plane -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://ground_plane</uri>
    </include>

    <model name="cycle">
      <include>
        <uri>model://trisphere_cycle</uri>
      </include>

      <plugin name='keystojoints' filename='libKeysToJointsPlugin.so'>

        <!-- up-arrow -->
        <map key='16777235' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_left_spin' scale='500' type='force'/>
        <map key='16777235' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_right_spin' scale='500' type='force'/>
        <!-- down-arrow -->
        <map key='16777237' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_left_spin' scale='-500' type='force'/>
        <map key='16777237' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_rear_right_spin' scale='-500' type='force'/>

        <!-- left-arrow -->
        <map key='16777234' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_front_steer' scale='0.1' type='position' kp='1000' ki='0' kd='10'/>
        <!-- right-arrow -->
        <map key='16777236' joint='trisphere_cycle::wheel_front_steer' scale='-0.1' type='position' kp='1000' ki='0' kd='10'/>

      </plugin>
    </model>
  </world>
</sdf>

update.description:
I made a tricycle model with spherical wheels and front steering. It will be used in a test for the gazebo WheelSlipPlugin (added in [gazebo PR 2950](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2950/adding-wheelslipplugin-for-adding-wheel/diff)).

![trike.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3164252219-trike.png)

The model has an embedded-ruby template, and I've tinkered with a "chopper" model using the following patch:

~~~
diff -r 97a7daf87cb5 trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb
--- a/trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb    Thu May 31 13:29:34 2018 -0700
+++ b/trisphere_cycle/model.sdf.erb    Thu May 31 16:30:41 2018 -0700
@@ -7,11 +7,11 @@
 
   # Geometry
   wheel_radius    = 0.15
-  wheelbase       = 6 * wheel_radius
-  half_track      = wheelbase * Math.tan(30 * Math::PI/180)
-  caster_angle    = 10 * Math::PI / 180.0
+  wheelbase       = 10 * wheel_radius
+  half_track      = 0.8*wheelbase * Math.tan(30 * Math::PI/180)
+  caster_angle    = 50 * Math::PI / 180.0
   fork_length     = 1.5 * wheel_radius * Math.sqrt(2)
-  headtube_length = 0.5 * fork_length
+  headtube_length = 1.0 * fork_length
   front_steer_L   = headtube_length + fork_length
   front_steer_dx  = front_steer_L * Math.sin(caster_angle)
   front_steer_dz  = front_steer_L * Math.cos(caster_angle)
@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@
   fork_offset = fork_length - 0.5*front_steer_L
   wheel_x0     = rear_steer_dx
   wheel_y0     = half_track
-  steer_limit  = 55 * Math::PI / 180.0
+  steer_limit  = 30 * Math::PI / 180.0
 
   rear_wheel_locations = {
     "rear_left"   => {:x0 => -wheel_x0, :y0 => wheel_y0 },
~~~

The chopper is not committed in this branch; it's just an example of how the parameterized template can be used.

![chopper.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1384378253-chopper.png)
